meanings.definition: To cut down all the trees in an area, leaving no forest behind.
meanings.sent1: The loggers will clearcut the entire forest for timber.
meanings.sent2: It is clearcut that the old trees need to be removed for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: I asked the beavers to clearcut the area, but they took it too literally!
meanings.sent4: Her decision to clearcut the clutter in her room made it feel more spacious.
meanings.sent5: The image of the clearcut forest haunted her dreams.

meanings.sent1: The instructions were clearcut and easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: It was clearcut that she was the best candidate for the job.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a magic trick was so clearcut that even the kids saw through it.
meanings.sent4: The solution to the puzzle was as clearcut as daylight.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cancel the event was clearcut and final.

meanings.definition: A piece of land where all the trees have been cut down.
meanings.sent1: The clearcut behind the house was now a barren field.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalists were saddened by the sight of the clearcut.
meanings.sent3: The clearcut became a popular spot for picnics after the trees were removed.
meanings.sent4: The clearcut stood as a stark reminder of deforestation.
meanings.sent5: The animals had to find new homes after their forest was turned into a clearcut.
